newsitem.title: UK: NWE straight-run fuel oil flat, Russian hard to mo.
newsitem.headline: NWE straight-run fuel oil flat, Russian hard to mo.

text.p: European straight run fuel oil prices were little changed on Wednesday despite a gain of $1 a tonne in the underlying fuel market.
Low sulphur was pegged around $96 a tonne fob NWE while Russian talked $5 a tonne above mean of means for M-40 and $3 above for M-100.
"It been diffcult to shift M-40 today," said a broker. The most recent Russian poor quality M-40 sold at just $1 above the mean of means on Tuesday.
